TopicTitle: [0.23] Crowd-sourced Science Logs: SCIENCE NEEDS YOU!

Articles.Content:
Are you volunteering?

I could maintain the project, but I'll finish my mod first (couple of days) and then begin with this.

I've sent codepants a PM about this. My idea is to simply have a script compile the config file. It will not be edited by people, and users do not have to copy & paste the text themselves.

It also involves a better way to send in new science logs and a way to keep track of your submissions and an easier moderation system.

I'm just waiting to hear back from him, to see what he thinks of it.

I've sent codepants a PM about this. My idea is to simply have a script compile the config file. It will not be edited by people, and users do not have to copy & paste the text themselves.

It also involves a better way to send in new science logs and a way to keep track of your submissions and an easier moderation system.

I'm just waiting to hear back from him, to see what he thinks of it.

That's exactly what he want, but someone have to write it.
I can write it, shouldn't be too hard. Give me a few days and I should have a working prototype.

I can write it, shouldn't be too hard. Give me a few days and I should have a working prototype.

great, can't wait

You need someone to manage properly tested PERIODICAL releases. Just letting anyone edit releasecode, and then just pointing normal players at the live version of that code, does not work - and for this reason, not even most opensource projects do that. The current state of this project isn't anarchy - anarchy is order without governance - this project has no "order" and "structure".

Funny, it was working fine until recently. I admit I've been less than present lately but for the first few (five?) months we had it down pat. Anyways, as you may know, I'm accepting ideas to make it better. So don't whine, make a suggestion. Maybe things will change.

I've sent codepants a PM about this. My idea is to simply have a script compile the config file. It will not be edited by people, and users do not have to copy & paste the text themselves.

It also involves a better way to send in new science logs and a way to keep track of your submissions and an easier moderation system.

I'm just waiting to hear back from him, to see what he thinks of it.

Replied. <3

How do I use this mod?

Sorry for the noob question, I'm kinda amateur with this stuff.

How do I use this mod?

Sorry for the noob question, I'm kinda amateur with this stuff.

Replace (after making a backup!) the ScienceDefs.cfg that is inside your Squad\Resources folder.
ummmmm........ is there any reason that my eva reports give me a LOT of science. It is like 600 for near kerbin

Just posting here to indicate my interest, should anyone manage to make this something that adds, rather than replaces (MM sounds like a good bet). It sounds fascinating, and would really liven up the whole science collecting process.

This is in no way intended to be a 'go, now someone make this for me!' kind of thing, just some appreciation and enthusiasm

(And a quick edit because I've realised I can just swap this in now without affecting other things (I think), so I'm off to try it and see what happens )

Edited July 27, 2014 by A9p
new information

It also involves a better way to send in new science logs and a way to keep track of your submissions and an easier moderation system.

Do you have any progress?
Thank to all the hard work that has gone into this little gem. I can't wait till it is updated, it adds so much flavor to an already great game.

Do you have any progress?

Certainly, bear with me, I've been a bit busier with work than I thought I would be, but it's coming along. I keep thinking about features to add, but I should just get the basics done first. Not a whole lot left to do on that, so shouldn't be too much longer.

Then I'll put it online somewhere, so you can see how it would work, and then I'm open to suggestions

Certainly, bear with me, I've been a bit busier with work than I thought I would be, but it's coming along. I keep thinking about features to add, but I should just get the basics done first. Not a whole lot left to do on that, so shouldn't be too much longer.

Ok, thx. I thought that you abandoned it
Not rushing you or anything, more of a congrats then anything.
I (thankfully) have a older version of this which works fine and I am enjoying what the kerbals have to say

I (thankfully) have a older version of this which works fine and I am enjoying what the kerbals have to say

Why wouldn't this work? You just have to copy/paste it in the GamaData folder

I am removing the ability to add comments. It used to be people would post only about typos, etc. Now 90% of the posts are rubbish and the other 5% are people trying to submit their logs through comments. You must submit your log through the form.

For the other 5% who are using comments the way they should be used, I am sorry. I just don't have the time to comb through all the other crap.

I wish I could read these reports in Sandbox, given the fact that I contributed with a few of them.

Y squad, y u do dis.

The ScienceDef.cfg file does not work in 0.24.2 for me...it breaks the science-gather sensors (thermometers, barometers, etc.).

Surprising, I thought for certain this would work...guess I'll need to wait for the update.

EDIT: Nevermind, bad download! (did seem kind of big at 2.3 mb). Keep up the great work, everyone!

Edited August 19, 2014 by Synthesis

Okay, i just downloaded the unmod version, and it looks like some ....... has taken out the id, basevalue, sciencecap etc. and left in only the actual logs, so this seems to cause the mod to break all your science machines so that you cant take any science

Is anyone else having troubnle accessing the file? I can't tell you anything more specific, it just says 'There's an error with this file. Please reload.' Of course, the message appeara again when I reload. The error has been reported to Google.
You should have the moderated version be open to comments, so people can add to it, yet still be moderated.

anyone having the same logs over and over and over? even when it eventually varies the variations themselves are few, anyone know how to force ksp to actually randomly pick the logs?

i've checked the actual logs and found that it only ever picks the first line that matches the situation, never anything else, just goes for the first in line. this most likely is a ksp's fault but like i said, i wonder if anyone here (who are more likely to have found this problem) has a solution?
